metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5554 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 6u121, 7u111, 8u102; and Java SE Embedded 8u101 allows remote attackers to affect integrity via vectors related to JMX. It was discovered that the JMX component of OpenJDK did not sufficiently perform classloader consistency checks. An attacker could use this to bypass Java sandbox restrictions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5554` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-jre - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-jre-jamvm - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
openjdk-8-source - 8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8u111-b14-2ubuntu0.16.04.2').
